title.rendered: Adrian “The Wildman” Cenni Pulls Off the Crazy 360 Degree Barrel Roll!

content.rendered: Attendees at the Baja 1000 got to see Adrian “The Wildman” Cenni become the first person ever to complete a ground to ground 360 degree barrel roll in a 4 wheel vehicle! We love a good trick jump but we doubt this’ll be topped any time soon!

title.rendered: Minivan Returns to Kill a Viper

content.rendered: Leon Reitman owns that incredible 1993 Eagle Summit minivan that’s been featured here before destroying those that judge all their books by covers on the drag strip. Now he’s sent us a recent video of him annihilating this Viper at the New England Dragway. People tell him all the time he must have put at least and extra $30,000 worth of work into this beast but according to Leon he’s only spent around $6,000 and 100+ hours of his own hard work to make this monster a reality! Well done!

title.rendered: Homemade Wooden Ferrari Boat

content.rendered: Venice is a city that has banned cars. It’s famously known for its canals and relies heavily on water way transportation to get people around. However this Ferrari loving individual won’t let one’s city’s rules stop from from cruising around in style! He’s built his own wooden Ferrari frame. He spent five months whittling a block of pine into this Ferrari F50 he powers with a Yamaha boat engine!

title.rendered: Woman’s Heels Create Massive Driving Fail

content.rendered: While negotiating a simple round-a-bout the woman behind the wheel of this car apparently got her heel wedged into the gas pedal and kept accelerating forward. Panicking and unable to stop she whips around the circle until finally coming to rest after plowing straight into a light pole. Everyone’s fine but hearing the reactions of the driver and her friend are priceless!

title.rendered: Motorcycle Chases Down Hit and Run Driver

content.rendered: While on a motorcycle tour of Germany this guy caught a driver who very deliberately ran into the side of a scooter and took down its driver. While dash cams are illegal in Germany this guy technically had one on his helmet and was using it for tourism purposes. He dropped off his passenger to help the victim then he took off in pursuit! He caught the driver and after the police arrived the driver lost his license and the victim is alright!

title.rendered: Woman Gets Birthday Present 43 years in the Making

content.rendered:
Watch Terry Dietrich be reunited with her Corvette Stingray that was stolen 43 years earlier! Terry was barely 20 years old in 1972 when she worked herself to the bone to save up enough money to buy her dream car: A Corvette Stingray. She only had the car for 6 months before it was stolen from her!

Now, 43 years later an insurance agent came out of retirement to deliver her newly found car to her on her 62nd birthday! The car has traded hands throughout the years when a used car dealer wound up with it and couldn’t match the vehicle history to the VIN. After some digging around the dealer found old police reports describing the car and realized what he had on his hands! Good for him for finding a way to get it back to her!

title.rendered: Incredible Reaction Speed Save Prevents Ferrari Wreck

content.rendered: Call this guy an idiot if you want to (he really is to be driving like this on public roads and not on a track) but you can’t fault him for his reaction speed. He’s test driving a Ferrari and pushing it to its limits on this road when someone pulls out in front of him (probably not thinking there’d be a Ferrari running around 100 MPH out there) and he has to act quickly. He swerves into the opposite lane and then narrowly avoids another car without over steering and sending the car into a spin.

title.rendered: 10 Cars that Should have Seen More Screen Time

content.rendered:
10. James Bond’s Unlimited Garage


Twitter / rallen78

Twitter / FotosCoches

80s Bond notably rocked a Lotus Esprit Turbo in For Your Eyes Only and an Aston Martin v8 Vantage in The Living Daylights. Both ridiculously gorgeous cars, no doubt the stuff gearheads’ dreams are made of, but let’s get real, it was the ramshackle Citroën 2CV that really stole the show.

9. The Batmobile


Twitter / pugmum1

A jet turbine engine, bulletproof armor, and voice command system (also, a CD recorder? If B.Wayne can’t wait to get back to the manor before dropping beats, his mixes must be *~legendary~*) made it practical as well as stylish. You try defending the city from the Joker with anything less.

8. What was Left of the Planes, Trains, and Automobiles Car


YouTube

All right, so this Chrysler Lebaron Town and Country is, ahem, somewhat niche. But you drive the wrong way down a highway, scrape between two tractor trailers, and catch on fire from a rogue cigarette butt and see how well you end up. “It’s not pretty to look at, but it’ll get you where you want to go.” And even better…


YouTube

7. Any Car from the National Lampoon’s Vacation Series


YouTube

The Griswolds’ Family Truckster, a 1979 Ford LTD Country Squire — in Metallic Pea, of course — is all the car you need for trekking across the country and hauling Aunt Edna.

If you happen to favor something sportier, Christie Brinkley’s Ferrari 308 GTS is probably more your speed (though maybe not the “LUV ME” license plate? I mean we’re not here to judge, but….).

 
Twitter / StuMillsCBC

For what it’s worth, we’re saving up for Cousin Eddie’s RV from Christmas Vacation.

6. Ghostbusters’ Ecto-1


Twitter / CarDogsMovie

Arguably one of the most recognizable icons of the Ghostbusters series, Ecto-1 was a combination ambulance/hearse that just needed a little bit of work.  A steal at $4800, huh Ray?


YouTube

5. Mr. Frye’s car in Ferris Bueller’s Day Off


Twitter / NatTranLLC

The 1961 Ferrari GT California, the stuff of legends. “It is so choice,” quipped Ferris, and boy, was he ever right. I can’t be the only one who wept a little (OK, a lot) when [SPOILER ALERT, though if I’m spoiling something from 1986 you really need to reexamine your life] this beauty crashed through the window and fell into the ravine, right?


Twitter / LongBeachAuto

Let’s face it, we’re all these dudes.

4. The A-Team Van


Twitter / OffencePolice

Normally the A-Team’s 1983 GMC G-15 van would be the type of vehicle you caution kids to stay far, far away from.


Twitter / swhammerhead

Though I dunno, he seems legit. YOLO, right?  Never mind that this ragtag bunch of wrongly accused war criminals were actually acting on the side of the good. No, the real problem is the wrath that Mr. T’s B. A. Baracus unleashes if anyone dares even look at his precious van.  Him pitying you will be the least of your worries.

3. The Dukes of Hazzard’s General Lee


Twitter / AnciraCJDSA

This 1969 Dodge Charger was almost perpetually airborne throughout its time on TV. To perform the Duke Boys’ death-defying stunts, it’s said that 320 General Lees were used: more than one per episode! How iconic is this vehicle? Well, it generated more fan mail than any of the cast members on The Dukes of Hazzard — and Daisy Duke’s, well, daisy dukes.

2. KITT from Knight Rider


Twitter / Colin Payne

Knight Rider didn’t just make The Hoff a household name — and inspire tons of punchlines about how much Germans love him. It also famously introduced us to Knight Industries Three Thousand, or KITT. Voiced by William Daniels, KITT was a crime-fighting 1982 Pontiac Trans Am with banter to spare.

 

1. The Back to the Future Time Machine


Twitter / PopMech

Of course, no list of iconic movie cars would be complete without Doc Brown’s time machine from Back to the Future. While reliability may not have been its strong suit— the DeLorean’s ability to get to 88 miles per hour in any sort of hurry was unpredictable at best — this was defi-nitely a case where the destination was more important that the journey. If that isn’t enough of a selling point for you, though, don’t forget that its spacious dashboard lends itself quite well to aftermarket customization.


Twitter / Thomie_ch

title.rendered: Ford F-150 Runs Over Ferrari

content.rendered:
Lets say you have the means to order a new Ferrari 458 Italia. You wait the year to year and a half it takes for it to finally be built and arrive. You drive it around for a few days and immediately fall in love. You attempt to cross a few solid yellow lines to hurry up on day and then find the front end of your brand new Ferrari under the wheel of a Ford F-150.

Luckily for the owner of this nearly doomed Ferrari the front of the car is merely the trunk space so the damage done isn’t Ferrari-life threatening but this is certainly heartbreaking none the less!

title.rendered: Cyclist Cuts Into Traffic, Flips Off Driver, Eats Karma

content.rendered:
…Well they eat karma and pavement.

Here’s a cyclist doing their thing in their own bike lane when another it suddenly narrows down after another cyclist passes them. When the cyclist with the camera eventually catches up they try to overtake the first bike and blindly step into the lane of a Mazda MX-5 who honks at them. The cyclist then flips the car off seconds before eating curb. While it’s fun to see an annoying cyclist take a dive it’s important to note that nothing appears to be injured.

Lets not also forget about the amenities like bucket seats and power windows – and for something this large: four wheel steering! This far from the most practical truck to drive around in but we can’t help to imagine what it’d be like to have a day out in the dunes with this boss!

It’s loaded with a blown alcohol injected 540 big block engine, a killer red and black color scheme, matte black spoke rims, a nice throwback of a grille, two and a half ton axles and a turbo 400 transmission. This beauty was made to carve up the mud! However, after just a few minutes of showing this beast off its wheels lock up and leave the owner with more than a bit of embarrassment.

title.rendered: The Peacemaker is an Off Road Demon

content.rendered: Mad Max: Fury Road involved the design and production of a number of great custom vehicles. One of the more overlooked of them all was the Peacemaker. It’s driven by a marauder known as the Bullet Farmer. Once you see it in action outside of the movie however, you’ll appreciate just how much of a beast thing is! title.rendered: Shoulder Drivers Get Caught by Police

content.rendered:
Don’t you hate it when you’re stuck in traffic on a highway? You’re inching forward and it takes several minutes to move even half a mile when all of the sudden some cars start screaming down the shoulder next to you. They’re cheating and breaking traffic laws because wherever they have to get to just must be so much more important than anyone else, right? Don’t you just wish there’d be a cop around at those moments to reign in those cheaters?

Well this dash cam video should make you feel better about those moments when the driver here refuses to let someone back in after shoulder driving when they spot a cop. Justice delivered!

They hired an excavator to show up and physically remove the cars by pushing them out of the way. Hopefully the drivers will get the message!

The passengers in this crazy series have to use their leverage to distribute their weight to help keep the bike on the ground without tipping over.
It makes for some very interesting handling and maneuvering!

title.rendered: Motorcycle Run Off Road, Driver Takes Off

content.rendered:
This poor helmet cam wearing biker was the victim of a terrible driver. The car ends up barreling towards him while drifting through the oncoming lane! The biker misses the driver but is forced to ride hard into the shoulder where he can’t maintain and has to lay down his bike.

When he gets up to see if the driver is around he realizes the jerk has already driven off. Sadly his helmet cam was out of focus so you can’t make out the license plate of the vehicle that nearly killed him but with a bit of luck the authorities should hopefully find them!

title.rendered: Road Raging Biker Screams at Mother in Front of Child

content.rendered:
We’ve just found out about this biker who’s incredibly good at giving bikers a horrible name. As if to justify his own terrible behavior he has uploaded this video of his own helmet cam as he curses at and threatens a woman (who technically did nothing wrong) right in front of her child.

He speeds up to pass her as she’s already 2-3 car lengths ahead and has her turn signal on. He makes a gesture to her as he passes in the wrong (as he’s obviously got some insecurity issues) and proceeds down the road. She then passes him and admittedly may scream by him a little too closely. He then catches up with her and gets her to roll down her window so he can proceed to strafe her with insults, threats and curses.

According to a little snooping on reddit.com he’s known for just this behavior. He uploads videos of himself cursing as drivers who aren’t committing any wrong as if he owns every road in America. This guy is certainly in the running for biggest D-Bag of the year!

title.rendered: Cop Dashcam Captures Car Explosion

content.rendered:
Just recently the police department in Austin, Texas captured this incredible footage of a car going up in flames! They responded to a 2 AM call regarding a disturbed individual skulking around a convenience store. When they arrived they noticed the man trying to get back into his car, which is always a bad sign, and the police came over to speak with him before he could leave.

Instead of trying to speed away the man ignited something. Maybe a hand held lighter, the car’s cigarette lighter or maybe even his own personal tool. He immediately flooded the car with fire and it blew both officers back. Apparently the man was trying to commit suicide an it took a police presence for him to realize that lighting one’s self on fire isn’t a good move…EVER.

title.rendered: Does the ATL have the best monthly car show in the USA?

content.rendered:
If this sweet clip doesn’t get you all tingly, we don’t know what will.

Caffeine & Octane has been an Atlanta tradition for almost 10 years. The first Sunday of each month over 650 classics, muscles and exotics gather to showcase their beauty for hundreds of drooling attendees. Best of all, it’s free.

Have you been? What are some other monthly car shows alt_driver should visit?

We’ll be out at Caffeine & Octane on June 7, 2015. Visit Caffeine & Octane for details.

title.rendered: Man Chases Down Hit and Run Driver

content.rendered: This dash cam footage came from a man who watched a car in front of him run a red light and hit a woman on a bike. While the woman appears mostly alright, with just her bike frame and tire slightly bent, she’s trying to speak with the driver and figure things out when he just takes off. The man in the car filming wasn’t about to have any of that. He chases the driver down a few streets to let him know he’s got the whole thing recorded so they had better return to the scene of the accident!

They like to police in style and they employ at least a few Lamborghini Gallardos in their fleet. So why not watch them tool around and get some donuts in.

The car itself should be able to send objects immediately around it and brake when necessary. This particular demo looks as though it was they meant to show off the car’s ability to stop on a dime autonomously. At least that’s the only explanation as to why the man in the pink shirt didn’t bother moving as the car started speeding towards him.

_yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: This poor, poor Corvette wasn't even 24 hours old off the lot when this unfortunate crash occurred. The driver had launch control issues after taking off and shifting into 2nd gear. This caused the Corvette to careen wildly into those trees. The driver was alright and all told there was only about $20,000 worth of damage.

title.rendered: Be Kind and Please Rewind for Some 90s Nostalgia

content.rendered:
If you were in a car in the 90s…

1. You sat in the “back, back”

Flickr / Travis Rigel Lukas Hornung

Or the Way, Way Back if your mom was dating Steve Carell

 

2. You were almost decapitated by the seat belt

colinc3 / YouTube

3. You used a road atlas…complete with trip notes


Flickr / Jimmy Thomas

4. You watched “Speed” on VHS in a conversion van


Flickr / Tracie Hall

5. You jammed out to a copy of your BFF’s mix tape


cheezburger.com

6. You rolled up your window and spilled your Surge

     

7. You used a car phone to page someone

    
Flickr / ShaneK & Flickr / Hades2k

And they called you back from a payphone

 

8. You did your part in the war on crime


piloteers.org

9. You had junk in the trunk

   
Flickr / Paul Altobelli
 
YouTube / Funny Fails

10. Your car had boobs

 
Wikipedia

title.rendered: Driver Nearly Crushes Moped Driver

content.rendered:
Here we have a driver stumbled upon a group of moped drivers. Not a group of bikers but rather a group of moped drivers. We didn’t really know moped drivers stuck together like that.

At any rate, one of the drivers takes a tumble after striking a divider and skillfully falls into the next lane of oncoming traffic. Luckily for him, the driver of this particular car knew to be wary of moped drivers and was more than prepared to swerve to avoid him.

title.rendered: Motorcycle Can’t Stop Quickly Enough

content.rendered: Some guys are cruising around Arad, Romania on the bikes when one of them runs afoul of a stopped car in an intersection. He tries to avoid the crash but can only stop so quickly for so long without going over the top. We can’t tell from this angle if the fault lies on the car or the motorcycle.

title.rendered: M3 Driver Made Passenger Throw Up Mid-Lap on The Nurburgring

content.rendered:
Watch this passenger, unable to hold their stomach, lose it in front of a crowd while halfway through a lap on the infamous Nurburgring track.

There’s a lot of speculation that this was a staged or set up advertising segment since the BMW involved was from a rental company around the track and the driver herself doesn’t really foot the bill as a serious car driver with her very high heels.

title.rendered: Motorcycle Burnout Leads to Motorcycle Burning

content.rendered: While pinning his bike to a tree this guy decides to push the limits of exactly how long he can burnout on his bike. While he shreds his rear tire into oblivion something catastrophic goes wrong. Presumably some malfunction leads to an oil leak when then ignites the whole bike!
